intro: Micrandra australis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring slender, often twisted branches. Its leaves are compound, with narrow, elongated leaflets that give it a distinctive appearance. It produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are typical of many species in the wattle genus.
